result.execSummary:
The defendant Mack A. Exson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mack A. Exson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mack A. Exson was found guilty of Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
++ Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside without court's permission.  May Not have conact with Ms Dixon.  May not reside with anyone of the opposite sex without court's permission.

Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge
8yrs WSP; initial confinement of 5yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Minutes:  Clerk/T.  Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 8yrs WSP consecutive to any previously imposed sentence; initial confinement of 5yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.

Minutes:  14CM1644/15CF118.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody (Dodge Corr) w/Atty Greg Bates.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.

15CF118 - deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.

14CM1644 - case dismissed & read-in on State's motion per plea agreement.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 11/11/16 @ 11:30am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody (prison) w/Atty Greg Bates.  Atty Bates reports the deft wishes for him to w/draw as counsel.  Discussion ensues.  Defense motion to w/draw is denied.  Defense requests new dates for add'l investigation.  No objection from the State.  FPT adj to 9/29/16 @ 11am, JS 11/7/16 @ 9am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody (prison) w/Atty Greg Bates.  Mutual request for an adjournment; notice of alibi needs to be investigated.  FPT adj to 7/29/16 @ 11am, JS 8/15/16 @ 9am.
Scheduling Order

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mack A. Exson appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Det Lenard Giannola; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Bates. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. DE files request for substitution of Br 8; tab pulled for Br 3.  Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 10:10 am.  Jury selection scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
by DE of Br 8; tab pulled for Br 3.
Atty:  G Bates.

121pm
  Special Prosecutor Joseph Curi appeared for the state.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Laura Walker.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on 4/21/16 @ 830am  before Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI  Bond is continued as previously set.  DE will now be represented by SPD.    jk

Defendant, Mack A. Exson, appeared.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JThwing. Minutes:    Court advises and hold a lengthy colliquy with DE about his right to an attorney, either a public defender or to retain his own counsel.  DE states he understands this right but wants to waive his right to an attorney.  Court orders DE to meet with SPD again before he waives his right to his attorney.   Time limits tolled.    Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

*No contact with Mary C D or her residence
943.32(1)(a) - Robbery w/use of force repeater  /  940.19(2) - Substantial battery, repeater

121 p.m.  Special Pros  Joseph Curi.   Defendant appeared in custody.  Clk  Janell Thwing.   Deft waives his right to counsel.   Warrant vacated.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 10:15 am.  $2000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).   Deft is SPD eligible but does not wish to use them at this time.
